column4: does anyone know how to include network locations in cases like say you are uploading an image through a website, you click upload and you get the file browser... network locations do not appear, not even bookmarked ones... how to fix this?
look in your .gvfs directory?
the .gvfs directory shows nothing, changes the backround of the dialog to pink
/home/cprint
the location of the file you are trying to access..
/home/cprint is just your 'home' directory.
. yes.. so browse to the location of the file. and look at the address..
smb://cpserv01/server/Website%20Files
when i access a smb:// place here its showing up in .gvfs for me
just uploaded a image via firefox using .gvfs
that's unfortunate. I really hate having to copy entire directories to upload things to my webdev
I tried to even make link and it returned an error saying it can't
mount the share by hand to some static location of your choice.
thanks for your help I will try out a few things
aparantly I just needed to install SAMBA
it's all fully working now
if its possible. it would be in the ccsm/compiz settings
yes I've tried there but don't see an option that would relate to middle mouse. I thought in a previous version it just waited for a keystroke... I can't see where to get that anymore

yes in ccsm/expo it has a keystroke bind and under says button and shows a graphic of a mouse. when I enable it I get the popup with a dropdown of button 1 - 15. I can't find any relating to the mouse. Is mouse 3 not button 3 or mouse 3 in linux>?
you mean as a windows network neighborhood type share?
in the past when I would connect it would automount a drive that linked to my ubuntu home folder in windows
remmina is using RDP to connect to my windows
never really used RDP. but i thought RDP was for remote Desktp access, not accessing a 'share' like thing.
